ARABIC: قَالُوا۟ فَأْتُوا۟ بِهِۦ عَلَىٰٓ أَعْيُنِ ٱلنَّاسِ لَعَلَّهُمْ يَشْهَدُونَ

ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_0: They said, 'Bring him before the people's eyes so they can be witnesses.'
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_1: Bring him before the people," they said, "that they may bear witness."
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_2: The others said: "Bring him, then, before the eyes of the people that they may see (what will be done to him)."
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_3: Their chiefs said, "Bring him before the eyes of the people and let them testify that he has spoken against the idols."
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_4: They said, “Therefore bring him in front of the people, perhaps they may testify.”
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_5: They said: "Then bring him before the eyes of the people, that they may testify."
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_6: Said they: Then bring him before the eyes of the people, perhaps they may bear witness.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_7: They said, 'Bring him before the people's eyes; haply they shall bear witness.'
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_8: They said: Then bring him (hither) before the people's eyes that they may testify.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_9: They said, "Then bring him here in the sight of all the people, so that they may act as witnesses."
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_10: They said: bring him then before the eyes of the people, haply they may bear witness.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_11: They said, ‘Bring him before the people’s eyes so that they may bear witness [against him].’
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_12: They said, "Then bring him before the eyes of the people, that they may bear witness."
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_13: They said: "Then bring him before the eyes of the people, that they may testify."
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_14: They said: 'Then bring him here so that the people may see, so that they may bear witness'
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_15: They said, “Bring him before the eyes of the people, so that they may witness.”
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_16: They said, "Then bring him before the eyes of the people that they may testify."
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_17: [21:61] They said, ‘Then bring him before the people’s eyes, that is, openly, that they may testify’, against him as being the perpetrator.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_18: (They said) Nimrod said to them: (Then bring him (hither) before the people's eyes) in the presence of people (that they may testify) that he did it; and it is said that this means: that they may testify that he said he will demolish them; and it is also said that this means: that they may witness his punishment.
